description:
One of my favorite sandwich places hands down. Pops sandwiches has some of the best deals on town! You're gonna be blown away by the quality and effort in making an awesome sandwich. I always get a simple turkey avocado sandwich from here and I seriously love it. What separates this place from other sandwich shops and delis is how fresh the turkey and avocado are. They are really generous with their portions as well.

Everything about pops is amazing and I want you all to give this place a try!
author: John M.

description:
Certainly can't find any fault with the sandwiches and family and fiends have been here as new customers on my recommendation.  For that, 3 stars. 
Would be more but: Jeff, what oh what is going on. Is good help hard to find? I'm an employer too and I know it is. But,  an employee's abilities, or lack there of, reflect Managment's abilities to train and mentor. 

Example: keep the money received out of the register until change is made. This will avoid questioning the customer's integrity about the denomination of the bill presented. And will hopefully avoid what apparently was an employee breakdown and escape to the back room during what turned out to be a mini rush today.  

Oh, and a smile and friendly greeting to customers would go a long way too. Haven't seen that here at Pops for quite some time. 

Will I be back or recommend again? At this point, can't really answer. Maybe, for the quality and variety of sandwiches. Maybe not for the decline I've seen in service during my last couple of visits.
author: Joe P.

description:
This place is really good! I'm not a huge sandwitch person, but I love this place. We've been living a few blocks away from this place for the past 4 years, and I we never tried it, I guess I never liked their sign or just the look from the outside.

My husband one day got their Zippy's Chicken Club so I had a few bites and I was hooked!! It's perfectly toasted, and there is a balance of meat lettuce and sauce. 
I've only tried the Zippy, since I cant' get myself to eat anything else. 
I would definitely recommend it.
author: Mina D.

description: Great sandwiches at an affordable price, a full meal for $8.95 in SF is a steal. The staff is very friendly, not a lot of seating but you can take the sandwiches to go!
author: Jessi C.

description:
I have ordered many times from them online and always enjoyed their sandwiches. I prefer theirs to the local sandwich shop actually. I wish there were more choices for bread on he Yelp app because they clearly use other breads aside the choices given but aside that, I can't really complain. 

Service itself is a bit cold at times. Drivers deliver with a lackluster attitude and I find myself wondering why I am tipping at all. There is a delivery fee but if you get my order on time to my home, that alone isn't exactly a reason for me to tip you lol. Early? Yes I will tip extra. But doing your job description doesn't exactly mandate a tip from me. Being a nice person who doesn't shove a bag into my face as they take off without even a word does. The guy who answers the phone is very nice and was helpful with an order that was MIA via the Yelp app (thanks Eat24! *eyeroll) and when I contacted Yelp (Eat24) for help I was met with no response as well. Very annoying for an almost 2hr wait. 

The different sandwiches I've had all have me full and happy with minimal mess (sometimes their sauce can wet up the sandwiches for a delivery) and their prices aren't too bad even with their delivery fee. I like the tootsie pop included. 

The only thing I didn't like was their macaroni salad. It was bland and not very flavorful but it was nice having crisp veggies in it. The potato salad was very hit or miss. One day it was VERY vinegary and I found it hard to eat it. I tried to order it again but this time it was the complete opposite - bland and tasted like dry potatoes with not much else lol. So I guess I'll leave out the sides from now on. 

Overall I give it 4 stars because I like most of their food but not much their service. They deliver and lately my roommate orders a lot of sandwiches from the place down the road a ways and their sandwiches just aren't my thing. This is a great alt.
author: Bella B.

description: Hands down the best sandwiches in the city, no lie! I got a veggie sandwich which was only about $7 and it was HUUGE i was so happy lol. I went with my friend who also loved her sandwich which had meat! Super good, would recommend and dream about their sandwiches all the time lol
author: Claire L.

description:
I'm eating the Political Correctness sandwich (vegetarian) with added eggplant. It's amaze balls! 
I've lived in the neighborhood for years yet never tried Pop's, I feel like such a fool.
This place deserves 5 stars no doubt.
It's time to stop supporting big chains and start coming back to family owned businesses like this one. It's like walking into someone's home and getting a home made sandwiche.

Yelpers remember: just because someone made a small or even a big mistake with your order doesn't mean you can crap on their establishment. Behind this app there's a person like you and me reading those reviews.

Thanks for a great sandwich!
author: Jakub P.

description: Would have loved to try the food here. Unfortunately, the cashier didn't waste a second answering phone call after phone call. We waited 10 minutes at the front of the line just trying to place an order before walking out. The lack of service here is ridiculous and we will not be returning.
author: Andrew L.

description:
got delivery. this was yummy! Twin Peaks sandwich was good and so was the Pastrami.
delivery was quick enough! always be patient with delivery.
author: Tracy L.

description:
So good and hits the spot! I always get my sandwiches with the works. Pops always delivers with a tootsie pop to boot.


Update! They don't deliver to my address anymore! They got me hooked, and then left me! 

If Pop's joins Uber Eats so I can still indulge, I would definitely bump my rating back up to 5! 
I'm sad and hangry :-(


Update #2! Thank you so much for letting me know about Postmates! I just got my delivery and am a happy gal! Just as expected, these sandwiches were delicious!
author: Amber Renee C.

description: Very good sandwich shop I want to go back and try the rest of their specials and I like how they pay homage to Jeffrey Leonard and there seems to be some connection to my alma mater USF.
author: Jay B.

description:
Just not a fan of this place.  The bread was burnt on my Free Bird sandwich, which is a shame because that was the best one I ordered.

The reuben was lackluster - not much except meat and bread.  Where was the sauerkraut?  Rye bread?  Nope.  Just wheat bread.

Delivery was prompt.  But will never be back to this place.
author: Andrew P.

description: Great sandwich shop in Miraloma.  Love their meatball sub!  It's perfect...toasted sourdough roll, melted provolone, and delicious meatballs.  Ask for a side of marinara. The folks are always friendly and accommodating.  Give it a try!
author: Kim A.

description:
I have recently had this obsession with deli like sandwiches. And Pop's has made it to the top of the list. I'm so thankful that this shop is in my beloved city and I can eat it weekly (AHA!). 

Pop's has definitely perfected their sandwich. One Flap Down is my ultimate favorite. Then comes Twin Peaks. I have yet to try them all, but I wouldn't doubt their deliciousness. 

I wish they could stay open a little later since I tend to eat a late dinner.
author: Dara S.

description: Always delicious.  Super friendly staff.  Love this little sandwich shop. The potato salad is to die for!
author: Aaron H.

description:
This wonderful neighborhood sandwich shop is in Miraloma Park. Delivery is NOT in your best interests; if at all possible just go there and pick it up.
.
At $9.45 I am especially fond of the Free Bird on Dutch Crunch (with dressing - add $0.97). For another $0.99 I also add a small bag of chips. My lightly toasted hot sandwich will be ready in about 10 minutes or less and come with a little surprise lollipop.
.
They can be quite busy at times so prepare yourself for the time it may take to complete your hot sandwich. 
.
KUDOS!...you guys are GREAT!
author: Caesar A.

description: Last year I wrote a pretty messed up review about this place. I want to apologize. I went back today and got a sandwich. It was really good. People were very nice. My original review got really personal and wasn't professional at all.
author: Carlos G.

description: Im updating my review. Although the food was not delivered on time and it was not the best being that it had been so long, I wanted to change my review because the owner of the establishment reached out to me personally to offer his apologies. I appreciate this level of customer service and don't think that the business should be faulted due to the shortcomings of certain employees. Pro tip: eat there, don't get delivery.
author: Harrison K.

description: The owner reached out to me to make this ordeal good again, which is much appreciated. I'm updating my original 2-star review to a 4-star review since their sandwiches are really good. I especially love their meatball sandwich, The Herb Tribute!
author: Tiffany U.

description: This place is the only sandwich place I will eat at because my standards are so high and they Fulfill it every time I go, and when I go to any other place they always mess up my order and if they don't do that the food is terrible. The owners are very considerate and respectf.
author: Timothy S.

description: Don't bother. Ordered once and they were good.  I ordered today and they must have thrown it in the round file.  After cancelling, the driver showed up over an hour after he was supposed to be here.  2 hours to make a sandwich and a salad.  Just have to wonder how much they respect their customers!
author: Dan D.

description:
If your driving through San Francisco, this place is a place you need to stop and try. GREAT sandwiches!!
Ask the one of the lady's for her off the menu special. 
Amazing!!!
author: George S.

description:
I haven't posted a review in years, but seeing the 1 and 2 star ratings makes me shake my head in anger for such a quality business.  I'm a HUGE sandwich guy and Pop's sandwiches are some of the best around, hands down!  I used to go to Subs in West Portal on a weekly basis, but this is now my regular spot.  Whether I'm bringing it home, eating in the car, or taking it to the game, it's always what I expect.  One Flap Down is my go to but you really can't go wrong with any of the other sandwiches.

As for people posting bad reviews based on delivery.  You obviously don't cherish the integrity of your sandwich much do you?  Every employee works extremely hard here with the amount of foot traffic they see, so listening to complaints over the phone is probably a little tough for how busy they are.  Before all these food delivery services even existed, you might not have had the luxury of even having a Pops sandwich delivered to your door.  Take it for what it is at that point, or get off your butt and pick it up hot and fresh.  Come in to the store and you'll see how good these sandwiches really are and how great the staff is.

Keep it up Pops!!!  See you this afternoon!
author: Mike F.

description:
This place gets a solid "A-OK" by me.  That maps to 3-stars on Yelp, which in my book is quite respectable.  Perfect place if you happen to be in the neighborhood; maybe if you need some refueling after hiking Mount Davidson.  Not quite at the level of a Roli Roti where people justifiably brave crazy lines for a sandwich nor is it worth a special pilgrimage all the way to Miraloma.  But their food definitely seems like the most appealing of the nearby strip mall options and you'll leave quite satisfied.

Joey Bag-a-donuts: A trifecta of meats with beef meatballs, grilled chicken breast and bacon!  And, of course, it wouldn't be complete without a whole lot of melted provolone.  I liked the meatballs since they were moist and quite a generous portion.  The grilled chicken breast was about what'd you expect; a fried chicken cutlet would been better, but hey it's still decent chicken simply grilled.  I wasn't a fan of the bacon since it wasn't crispy and was a skimpy portion.  The marinara sauce covering everything added a nice tang to contrast the meat overload; a good amount but not so much that you're dripping sauce on yourself.  Reminiscent of the hot Italian subs served by a pizzeria in your hometown, wherever your Any Town, USA hometown may be.
author: Adam B.

description: I've ordered online thru Grubhub a couple of time. They tuna salad is truly a great meal. Lots of tuna along with a good amount of fresh slice avocado with cheese, tomatoes, ... I couldn't have asked for anything more. Their sandwiches were quite good. Plenty of good meat. I've had both Pastrami and Turkey.
author: John S.

description: Good sandwiches. Got the flap down. Salami gave it a nice spicy kick. Kinda wished there was more meat but didn't bother me. Toasted to perfection and shredded lettuce a must.
author: Danielle H.

description: I was pleasantly surprised to learn they have a gluten free bread option and even more surprised at how good it tastes! It truly is one of the better gluten free rolls I've had. The sandwich I got was good and all, but I'll really be coming back for the bread.
author: B J.

description: I wished their sandwiches blew me away but that didn't happen. I think their main problem is inferior ingredients. My Reuben, I felt was made from store bought mediocre quality pastrami. The bread was just meh. Sour kraut tasted from a jar. Ruben is a tough sandwich to get right. Maybe I should try other things but hey if ain't good, don't sell it.
author: Lo F.

description: This is our favorite deli sandwich shop in San Francisco. We have ordered several of their specialty sandwiches and have enjoyed them all. Their bread is also very good. Delivery has always been on time as well.
author: Yrev T.

description: A pizza sandwich??? I'm in heaven. This little shop won me over. Try it for yourself and oh, there is ample parking if you're driving.
author: Bulldog W.

description: Ummmmm, so freaking good!  Family owned and operated, amazing service, crazy delicious!!!!  Can't wait to come back!  They may have a new regular!
author: Travis T.

description:
Peeps up in Portola should be thanking their lucky stars to have a place like Pop's in their neighborhood. Most neighborhoods don't have a local sandwich shop this good (and I've been to all the highly rated talked about ones in the city but feel free to shoot me a line if you think I've missed one!).

Better than average sandwiches. Real solid. Not sure they're worth trekking across town for - missing a wow factor. But for your local place you can't go wrong.

My friend swore by the Blazing Saddles and Free Bird but we ended up getting the Brooklyn Bridge and Twin Peaks. The Brooklyn Bridge was good. Liked how they toasted the rye bread. Pastrami yummy. But the sandwich was a little dry. I wonder if I could get it with the Thousand Island Dressing instead to juice it up a little? The Twin Peaks was good too. The avocado was nice and ripe and kept that sandwich moist. Went great with the lettuce, tomato, pepperonci, etc salad-like topping. Dutch crunch was the way to go with that one.

I'll be looking forward to visiting this neighborhood again for the Joey Bag-a-donuts.
author: Jean K.

description:
I'm pretty sad about giving this place two stars because their sandwiches are really good. I ordered the free bird with avocado and stuffing on dutch crunch (as suggested by another yelper!) on eat24. Just FYI, there's a $15 minimum and $2 delivery charge. 

Anyways, the sandwich took an hour to be delivered and when it did, it was soggy and cold. On top of that, they forgot my avocado and put my sandwich on rye bread. GEE, thanks. I will say though, it's probably one of the best sandwiches I've ever eaten.
author: Ara K.

description:
I phoned in a sandwich order for: turkey,  avocado, bacon, light mayo on dutch bun. As i got to the store i made sure i thoroughly  explain which sandwich  i was picking  up. After reassurance it was  the right  sandwich, i left. Once at home, i found out the order was wrong (it had cranberry  sauce  in it). When i got back to the store to ask for the right sandwich, i was asked to pay for the new sandwich. Since i had specifically asked for the right sandwich and had reassured it was right, i felt i shouldn't  have to pay for a new one. The owner  claimed i did NOT ask to double check the ingredients before i left. They refused to replace the sandwich with the  right one. On top of that, they wanted to keep the first sandwich. I mean, they mess up the order,  refuse to replace it with the right order, want to charge me for a new sandwich AND keep the old one.
So if you ever go to the sandwich please make sure that you double check your order. and you know what you're going to order cuz they have specifically names for different sandwiches, and I don't like cranberry as it is and that was what in the sandwich. and then she pay for the avocado and they didn't even put it in there. :(
author: Lizzie G.

description: This place absolutely smacks. I'd come here anytime and their sandwiches will still be bomb. The customer service was good and so was the twin peaks that ashley made for me. It was like it was made from love. Anyone that's looking to get there sandwich fix needs to come here
author: Ryan S.

description:
The turkey cranberry sandwich here is so good, it actually inspired my boyfriend and I to start making it at home. We're in love with it, but we can't be constantly spending $25-ish every single day just to get our mutual fix! Hahaha. But seriously, it's so good.

We order the sandwiches from here off of Eat24 (that's how we discovered this place), and when we're out of the city + trying somewhere new, we always try other turkey cranberries and are like, "Wow. Nothing compares."

We like to order the basic turkey cranberry and add pesto, avocado, thanksgiving stuffing, and sometimes bacon to round it all off. Delicious!

Actually, we're gonna' order it today, too! I feel like Pop's could easily make burgers, and everyone would love them. If their burgers are as good as their sandwiches, I'd be in for sure! Feeeeed meeeeee.

Oh, and the sandwiches are huge. Like, 6 foot Subway length, but bigger and better. Totally worth the money!
author: Sherilynn M.

description:
I ordered through the EAT 24 App, I like that they deliver but I did not like the delivery service. The food came at the estimated delivery time, but the guy delivering my food was rude. Here's what happened, I bought two sandwiches and total came up to be $21, delivery included. At the time, I could not find my wallet and I was running around the house looking for change and when I finally had enough to pay, tips included. The delivery guy responded very rude and sarcastically.The sandwiches however was very good, I had the Free Bird with Avocado + stuffing on dutch crunch. I also had the tuna salad sandwich on dutch crunch the next day, toasted up in the oven and it was delicious.

IF!!!! you are going to try this place, skip the delivery and just come pick one up yourself and you will leave very satisfied.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: I ordered my sandwich for delivery. The sandwich was good, not amazing but good. The sourdough bread was delicious. My driver was fast and very nice! The only thing I would change is roast beef. The quality of the meat was so so. Other than that the sandwich was good. I would order from here again.
author: Danielle A.

description:
They literally sent me a sandwich that had bites taken out of it. My potato salad had also been partially consumed.  When I called them to ask about it, the woman said I was a last that this could never happen.  Disregarding the fact that the driver arrived without the food the first time,and returned suspiciously soon thereafter with half consumed food. 

  I'm really bummed because I really liked pop's before,and would order at least once a week.  But I won't abide terrible service, and accusing your customers of being liars is only one of the issues I have after today.
author: Brooke B.

description:
Ordered my sandwich waited 10 minutes for the sandwich. When they brought it to me it was wrapped with white paper, which I thought was to hold it together. But after I took a bite, I realized it was to hide the fact that it was Burnt to blackness. I proceeded to eat because I was starving. Probably the most painful sandwich I've ever had. Hard as a rock. Burned. 
I'm sitting there pealing off the black crusted edges of the sandwich while I eat it crunching loudly, making a big mess everywhere. They turned eating a delicious lunch into a painful task. After I finished my sandwich flavored potato chip I asked them if they have any softer non burnt bread, they said something about a sweet bread that they ran out of. I won't be back. And I don't recommend this place.
author: Robert C.

description:
I think this place has some of the best sandwiches in SF. A friend helped me discover it. And I have been going back ever since. 

I love the free bird, I get it almost every time. An amazing sandwich. It is also way reasonably priced for a sandwich shop in the city.

Whenever I go here, the people are friendly and my sandwich, although I call ahead, is always ready in 15 minutes or so. I have never had to wait a long time to get my grub.

They also have a system that remembers what you ordered the last time you ordered. So if you are a creature of habit, like myself, it's super convenient.

And they give you a tootsie pop for dessert with your sandwich. I always love something a little sweet after lunch.

I come here weekly and so should you. Great sandwich shop, don't pass it up!
author: Chris D.

description: Got a Joey's bag of donuts. It's a sandwich. Meatball, bright marinara, bacon, mozzerella
author: E. W.

description: Awesome sammies!!  Brought my family here yesterday, my daughters both got the Meatball sandwich (Herb Tribute), they both loved it.  My wife got a tuna salad and thoroughly enjoyed it.  I got the Big Fat Greek Sandwich and it was out-of-this-world tasty.  I think the Kalamata olives put it over the top.  The bread is toasted and that is definitely the way to go.  We can't wait to come back.  Very tasty!
author: Robert C.

description:
No offense, but I can't fathom why anyone would compare these subs to Ike's.

Okay, maybe it's because you have to wait for both after you place your order, whether it be over the phone, online, or in person. Or maybe it's that both come on a bread roll. Maybe it's that both restaurants serve very big sandwiches. However, when it comes to the flavors, I don't think the two compare. 

I had a half of Lancelotti on Dutch Crunch for lunch today. I have to admit I was rather let down despite the positive recommendations I have heard about this spot from friends. My roll was hard and stale on the outside and soggy on the inside and the sandwich had a slight bitterness to it. I couldn't figure out whether it was the mustard, the salami, or the special sauce that was to blame for the odd aftertaste.

Overall, it was an okay sandwich but I felt the shop could really benefit from having a separate pick up and order line. Clearly, my sandwich would have been more enjoyable if it could have gotten to me faster.  I had to wait for three guys to place an order just so I could grab my sandwich and run out. Although I was told to wait 15 minutes before coming for my order, I had a feeling it was ready sooner than that because it was already sitting on the shelf by the time I came into the store. By the time I finally got to the front of the line to pick it up, it was barely warm.

Update: tried another sandwich, still not impressed.
author: Nina M.

description: Great sandwich shop. Tony Balloney on sourdough. It's all about the bread. Will stop by once a week! Friendly. I order in advance and pick up! Easy parking too.
author: Leon L.

description: Get your sandwiches from Pops!!!!  I have been coming here for a couple  years now and cant get enough of the Joey Bag of doughnuts sandwich (yum!!).  It takes a couple minutes but the food is made with love and the Pop's team is nice and polite.  Oh, and if you live in the area you can get delivery. nough said!
author: Matt W.

description: Honestly.....  great sandwiches but the service has gone down hill. Even when the place is empty you never wait less than 15 minutes. And how is it when the place is busy only ONE person works. The others stand around and watch.
author: Becky H.

description:
Ohhhhhhh PAPI!!! Ohhhhh PAPI!!!

Yes, I call out the restaurant's name as I enjoy one of their delicious and warm subs.  Big deal.  Don't judge me. :)

The sandwiches are THAT good.  I love their meatball and their One Flap down the best. The bread is always fresh and the aroma alone is worth coming in here for.  Haaaaaa

Order from home if you are coming to pick one up though. They get a lot of take out business and you could wait 10-15min for your sandwich if you just pop in. 

I like how they bag it up too. Napkins and a Tootsie Pop.  Can't beat the prices too :)
author: Brian S.

description: There's some good stuff on the menu here.  The meatball sub is nice, the turkey is nice.  I've never had a bad sandwich here.  It's a cut below some of the truly high-end places in the city, but you won't be disappointed if you pop in here for lunch.
author: Foodbag B.

description:
Delivery Review!

I've never eaten at Pop's Sandwich Shop, but I've ordered sandwiches from them a number of times.  The sandwiches are delicious, generously sized and a great price considering how big the sandwiches are. 

My husband and I really like the "Feeling Hot Hot Hot." It's the perfect amount of spice, and filled with meaty goodness. If you're looking for a great sandwich, check out Pop's.
author: Margaret I.

description: Best meatball sub I've ever had. I call ahead and pickup all of the time. Can't wait to try more of the menu.
author: Patrick S.

description: One of the best pastrami sandwiches in the city.. very friendly owner and staff.. used to come here all the time.. gonna have to stop by here more often.
author: Timur P.

description:
Transplants and visiting humans all ask the same multi-million dollar question.

How do you financially SURVIVE in San Francisco?!? 

Often in a look that tells you their soul has been shaken by the absurd prices that seem to dominant our city.

The answer to this my friend is very complicated but I am willing to share with you the secret key to success!!!


The answer is Burritos & Sandwiches.

Yes well priced and high value sandwiches and burritos will reduce the bleeding to your wallet during your journey to ultimate happiness in possibly the best city ever.

Pops seems to make my list of sandwich places that are worth it.

Good amount of meat, interesting variety of flavors, good bread, and a rewards system.

I personally love the 'Free Bird!!!' 

Turkey, Avocado and Cranberry sauce. I nearly fainted by the strength of that mouth orgasm.

Go my friends and share the secret so that those places charging $10-$100 for a burrito or sandwich can eventually die and rational pricing of food can return.

7.99 + Tax ( 0.70) Total of $8.69
author: Nathan A.

description: Pop's has the best sandwiches in San Francisco. This family owned sandwich shop has been a SF tradition for generations. All sandwiches are made to order and toasted, so I often call ahead to reduce wait times. I personally love their Italian on the Sourdough roll, which is called the Lancelotti! I love that it comes with a tootsie POP, which helps customers remember that this is called POPS!
author: William H.

description:
TLDR: not possible either read it. 

This review is poor because of pops' ability to deliver food and my experience with Eat24. Other than that I know nothing about pops. 

have no idea what there food tastes like although it looks good right! That's why this isn't a one star! 

So...

Eat24 has no way of checking if this place is being honest about menu items or delivery times so here's what happened. 

I had a 30 dollar order not a ton. 

Get a call saying they don't have the bottled cokes so I have to settle on cans. And you know the refund process on that shit is terrible so I said it's fine I'll eat the difference and it will be all good. 

Delivery time is 45-50 minutes. 

Get a call from my brother who is at the house an hour later and the food hasn't arrived so I hit the refresh button where Eat24 contacts them. Here is where it gets good. 

The estimated time stayed the same. And it stated a time that had passed about 15 minutes earlier. 

So this means that Eat24 contacted pops and asked them about a delay and was told there was no delay! 

At this point an hour has gone by. 

 I call almost right away and find out that the sandwiches are actually done and made. Cool! But their estimate is 30 minutes before I would be receiving them! So I have to eat a sandwich that has been sitting for god knows how long plus their estimate of 30 minutes. 

Then I cancelled the order. 

Anyway who knows when those things would have arrived on time.


Oh and the people there are laughing at the fact these things are happening! At least they were laughing under their breath while speaking to me! Wtf pops. A place I will probably never try now.
author: Noah K.

description: Ordered through the Eat24 app and after 1 1/2 hours of waiting, had Eat24 find out about my order. Pop's told them that it left and was on the way. Waited another 1/2 hour and had them check again. Apparently the misplaced my order and I get an email stating they were out of potato salad but they would put a "rush" on my order. Forget waiting 3 hours for food!! Cancelled the order and might not order there again.
author: John H.

description: Really disappointed in this place! We ordered for delivery.  1.5 hours later I get a call that they LOST OR MISPLACED IT...  really.. and sure we will do a rush order but your out of the Dutch bread.. awful!!!!!! DONT DO IT!
author: Michelle S.

description: I have never loved a sandwich more than my corned beef sandwich from Pop's Sandwich Shop. I just moved to SF and I think my life started the minute I took a bite of this masterpiece. From the perfect sour dough bun to the beautiful avocado. I was in heaven. I might have cried during and after eating the sandwich. No man will ever make me feel like this sandwich did. Thank you Pop. Thank you. I think i'm going to go broke eating your damn good sandwich. Bless tf up
author: Kat S.

description: So so good! I had my first sandwich here today and I'm in love! The Big Fat Greek on Dutch crunch toasted extra crispy is on another level. Love the tootsie pops included with all orders and the friendly service. Not many lunch options in this area but this place is great!
author: Semuteh F.

description: The Blazing Saddles is excellent. It's exactly how I like my roast beef sandwich (which I've never seen before on a menu). Roast beef with the perfect amount of horseradish, which adds a little zip and a lot of flavor. Lettuce, tomato, etc AND AVOCADO. Perfection.
author: Cliff H.

description: I was trying to do a delivery for postmates and this guy who owns the restaurant is clearly incompetent. First of all their phone is broken so it messed up my order. Then, I asked to see a receipt to take a picture for postmates. The manager proceeds to let me wait 10 minutes before asking if he needs to make my sandwich because he needed the receipt. So already I've wasted 35 minutes and he couldn't told me he needed he receipt. He then says its not my fault. Clearly sir it is. Service was ridiculous. Never coming back again
author: Caroline H.

description:
Awesome toasted sandwiches!  I went conservative with the Warren's BLT.   Lots of crispy bacon!  I'll be back to try the other choices for sure!  They have a good selection of sandwiches.  
Nice and clean with parking!
author: Jaime L.

description:
Great sandwiches, easy parking with a large metered lot out front. Love the Free Bird, Twin Peaks, and STM Bronco sandwiches. All sandwiches come nicely toasted with a tootsie roll pop on the side. 

We typically order our sandwiches for pick up since we live pretty close and find it's better to order in advance by phone or online and then pick them up. They are a small operation and it can take some time to make everything if you order in the shop and wait there for it since they have many call in / online orders going at the same time. The employees clearly are working hard and are very friendly though so I enjoy supporting this local business.
author: Julie N.

description: My favorite sandwich shop in the city. Great range of choices. They put a lollipop in each sandwich bag which is an interesting surprise.
author: Thomas S.

description: "It has been 30mins late for the delivery." "I don't know which driver took the order." "So I have to wait for un-estimated time for it?" "Yea".
author: Zhi Z.

description: I'm currently trying to check on my delivery order, that has taken 1.5 hrs so far and the woman answering the phone keeps hanging up on me! She couldn't give me an answer about how long, the first time I spoke with her and hung up before I could finish my sentence. Now she's just hanging up when she realizes it's me! Awful, awful customer service, I will NEVER eat here again!!!! So sad because their food is good.  Management should fire this woman for her poor and rude service.
author: Stethoscopes S.

description: Pop's sandwiches ARE good, but their delivery is very hit or miss. Despite living less than 10 minutes away, there have several times when it has taken 2 hours to actually get out food. Rather than run their own deliveries, they give them to the Round Table Pizza next door and let them do it, and it doesn't seem like they have much stock in making sure people actually get their food in a timely manner.
author: Lacy M.

description: I'm sad that I am giving this place 2 stars because their sandwiches are pretty awesome but my experience ordering through eat24 was as awesome. My order was almost 2 hrs late and had to throw away the sandwiches because they got really soggy. There goes my $21 lunch down the drain :(
author: Kathy P.

description: Great sandwiches to go.  I've gone through the entire menu.  Not a bad sandwich.  My person preference is to have my sandwich on a sourdough roll which I have on everything except their Ruben.  Minimal but satisfactory eat in facilities; I get my sandwiches to go.
author: John G.

description: Love the Herb Tribute. Also like the lollipop pop that comes with the sandwich. Overall for a person who doesn't care for sandwiches this place is pretty good.
author: Melissa A.

description: Pop's is my new favorite sandwich shop on this side of the city. My work sometimes takes me to a few job sites nearby and I have gone to Pop's twice in a row now. First time I got a Free Bird, the second time I got a Wharf. Both were incredible! Very fresh and were exactly what I was wanting. The customer service is also very nice and employees look like they are working hard. I plan on stopping by there whenever I'm in the area.
author: Tyler B.

description:
I have simple tastes when it comes to sandwiches. I like roast beef, peanut butter and jelly, meatball, the occasional BLT, but the sandwich I'm most likely to order is a ham and cheddar with tomato, lettuce, mayonaise and mustard along with oil and vinegar and salt and pepper if they're on offer. I know, I know, it's pretty pedestrian and I'm not sure where I picked up the habit (New York?) but this is the sandwich I love.

All this lead up is to say: Pop's Sandwich Shop provided me with one of the finest ham and cheddar sandwiches I've had in years, all on a terrifically toasted sourdough roll. I'm struggling to find a flaw in it, or the place itself. The cashier was sweet and the sandwich maker brought my sandwich over to me once he'd wrapped it up and gave it to me with a smile and a genuine well-wish.

Whilst living in London, I missed American deli sandwiches something fierce. Thanks to Pop's, I now know I won't have to go without!
author: Miriam W.

description:
I came here after my run for a quick to go lunch. A friend just moved into the area and suggested this place to try since she knows I love hot sandwiches!

Ambiance: 
It was warm inside, a few tables to sit on, cute mom & pop type shop which I love!

Order: 
The Lancelotti - Salami, Ham, Mortadella, Provolone, Mustard, Mayonnaise, Lettuce, Tomato, Onion, Pepperoncini, Aritchoke hearts and Special Dressing on Wheat roll. And it comes with a tootsie roll lollipop! $7.99

Set back:
15 minutes wait for a walk in order but worth all the wait! The person there did give me a heads up on the wait which was greatly appreciated. They had a big online order come in just before. I have never had a sandwich with artichoke hearts in it and it was sooo good! I loved my soft and a bit crunchy wheat roll bread. The sandwich was so big and chunky too! It was juicy and one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. I was really full after devouring my entire sandwich. Worth every penny.

Yummy Sandwich! I am definitely coming back to try more!
author: Jenny H.

description: Ordered the free bird with stuffing on Dutch crunch. Had to order two for the minimum delivery and it ended up being 22 plus tip. Arrived after an hour soggy, cold, and without stuffing (which I was charged for anyway).  The sandwiches are good but when you wait so long for a nearby sandwich shop and pay that much, it should be correct. It's not that hard to get an order right ... If you offer stuffing on it and I order it, how easy would it have been to get it right? Wouldn't order delivery again based on price and mistakes and quality of arrival.
author: Shannon C.

description: Good sandwiches, unfortunate business attitude. Ordered 5 sandwiches via Eat24 for a group, one sandwich was made with the wrong meat.  We called Pop's, they insisted we were mistaken even though we had our online order confirmation and were staring at a different meat. After much discussion, they said they'd send another one out to us in 45 minutes.  Replacement sandwich never arrived. Other reviews show similar business attitude when a problem arises.
author: Georgianna G.

description: They are horrible at getting their Eat24 orders delivered on the said time. This happens every time we order from them through the eat24 app. By the time the food gets delivered it's good and soggy...
author: Louie D.

description:
Not knowing where to eat on a Sunday afternoon, drove up to Twin Peaks and discovered this cute sandwich shop courtesy of yelp.

Not knowing what to order, I just went off of the other reviewers and got the Free Bird - turkey, bacon, cranberry sauce, lettuce...and stuffing. Basically a Thanksgiving dinner packed into a sandwich. I ordered and I guess they must have been busy because it took a good 15-20 mins before I got my to-go order...

Once I bit into the sandwich however, it was well worth the wait. Not only was I surprised by the crisp bacon, but the cranberry sauce was welcomed quite warmly with its not-overly fruity taste. The dutch crunch was toasted just right too so that the sandwich was not soggy like some other SF sandwich shops.

I will definitely have to come back here and taste some of their other creative menu items
author: Brandon Y.

description: LOVE POPS!  All of the sandwiches I have tried are wonderful.  I would put a cautionary on the "Blazing Saddle" sandwich.  They are very generous with the horse radish and it can be a little overwhelming.  My favorite sandwich has to be the "Free Bird"!!
author: Yvonne P.

description: The sandwiches are fine. The deliverymen not so much. Sometimes its late and sometimes you get harassed by the dudes wearing round table pizza shirts about the tip so its kinda lame to order from home as of 10/13/2015
author: Robert G.

description:
sandwiches are great {the twin peaks}

BUT... two times in a row now I have called for delivery even though I live right around the corner, because I am busy at home and its taken TWO HOURS or longer to get my sandwich, AND THEN I call manager to complain and ask where my food is, nicely... and she puts me on hold forever, then asks me if my address is one that it ISNT and then laughs, and says well it should be about 5 minutes...

No discount, or sincere apology.
screw this place, not giving them my business after this.
author: Kayla C.

description: Consistently delicious classic deli sandwiches, from very nice people. A neighborhood staple. Feelin' Hot-Hot-Hot and Twin Peaks are my go-tos, but there's tasty stuff up and down the menu.
author: George J.

description:
My boyfriend, his sister, and i were having a day in the city last weekend. As we were driving to the park we all realized how starving we were. Luckily we drove by Pops and decided to stop in for a few sandwiches. BEST LAST MINUTE DECISION IVE EVER MADE! 

It was sunday afternoon, only a handful of people in the shop. We ordered, waited no longer than 15 minutes and headed to the park.

Once we sat down and ate, I couldn't have been happier with our lunch choice :) 

And I'm one picky eater ;) 

I even found myself wanting it again the next day, too bad I'm an hour over the bridge or i would have been back!
author: Stephanie C.

description: Yummy hot toasted sandwiches. I got the politically correct which is their veggie sandwich with signature sauce. It was quite good. Just a little bit slow to make.
author: Andrea F.

description: It smelled good to walk in to and whet my appetite. Good combination of bread and flavors in the veggie sandwich I had, without any overly strong flavors by using too much of anything. Delicious!
author: Prof N.

description: The best sandwich spot in SF. I really like the twin peaks. Great value, great tasting sandwiches. A sandwich of this size and quality would cost you at least $5 more anywhere else.  friendly staff, they take a little while, but its worth it.
author: Yoli B.

description: I love these sandwiches. They're not too fancy, but just neatly composed sandwiches with fresh ingredients, creative combinations, good bread which is toasted, and melty cheese. Consistently great!!
author: Toby S.

description: Toasted, yum! Family feel, good ingredients and ordering with Eat24 app through Yelp is easy.
author: Mark A.

description: Clean, friendly staff and delicious sandwiches. Also a lots of street parking around, but also space in the parking lot (parking meter). There is a little rush time around noon, but the staff handle it perfectly. I will be back for sure.
author: Monique F.

description: Great sandwich shop that delivers thru eat 24. Did you know you can leave your house to enjoy it there in person. Are a majority of the negative reviews on here filled with pretentious SF eat24 people? probably... You know I support this shop because it's good food. If they're late on a delivery I'm not going to be whiny like most yelpers. I suggest not listening to the criticism on here because most people on here don't own any deli or a business. Mistakes happen but they're not big enough to stop eating here. I'm fed up with these losers reviewing spots that are bomb and whining like little kids. Grow up clowns! You try driving around the city dropping off food on time! Try these sandwiches they're immaculate and have some patience you SF snob yuppies you're not a food critic!
author: Matt M.

description: Love love love the twin peaks sandwich. The flavor and care that they put into every order has definitely made this place my go to sandwich shop in the neighborhood! They keep it fun with a tootsie pop with every order!
author: Ryan G.

description:
I hate to have to do this but I have do downgrade my previous review all the way down to one star. It's simply getting ridiculous now and I am officially done with Pops. The past FOUR times I have gone to Pops they have messed up my incredibly simple order. I order the same sandwich each time: turkey on sliced wheat with avocado and cranberry. That's it. Well each of the past four times I went they not only made it wrong but each sandwich was different from the next! I guess in theory there are a infinite number of possible sandwiches that they can make but, seriously, turkey on sliced wheat with avocado and cranberry...how do you mess that up four DIFFERENT ways?!? Today was the last straw-- I ordered my usual and was given a roast beef with pepperoncini, swiss, cranberry and avocado. Really!!?! WTF is that all about?!

Pops was nice because it is so close to our house but we are now officially sandwich free agents! Good riddance!
author: M. A.

description: Wish I could say whether or not their sandwiches are good. I'd recommend not having your first try of their sandwiches through a delivery order. Took over an hour and 15 minutes to make and deliver a cheese sandwich which didn't even come with any cheese on it. The bread was completely soaked through with dressing by the time it arrived and was completely squishy and inedible. I also didn't receive one of the items from my order. Their macaroni salad was okay, but I ordered potato salad which they had to replace because they were out of it. There's no chance I'd order their food for delivery again.
author: Sara W.

description: Owner just called back and made things right.  Sending refund coupons. Thank you for the great service.
author: Andrew P.

description: Had the Hot Copa & salami on Dutch crunch while my girlfriend enjoyed "the politically correct" also on Dutch crunch. It was delish. All the produce tasted great and the proportion of meat to veggies to bread was perfect.
author: Anthony F.

description:
I would've taken a picture of my sandwich but I couldn't resist diving in.

I've been to several places in the city but no meatball sub can compare to The Herb Tribute. Perfect sauce:cheese:meat:bread ratio. I hadn't been here in a few years so I was semi-expecting things to be different but NO! Just as delicious as I remember. 

Plenty of other delicious sandwiches to try as well and a parking lot for easy access.
author: Moe O.

description:
I went out with a friend for a lunch date to catch up and she suggested to go to Pops. I've never been there before so I figured what the heck, I'll give this place a try. They had a variety of regular and specialty sandwiches. There was a few choices of what kind of bread we wanted, which was a bonus! My friend decided to split the Free Bird on dutch crutch and may I say.... IT WAS SO GOOD!!! Exactly like a thanksgiving feast on a sandwich! 

I see there are some reviews that complained about the bad service they had there, but I experienced no difficulties there. The workers were having fun doing their job. Maybe it was cause my friend and I went right before the SOTA kids were out for lunch? But any who, I will most definitely be back again, whether to get the Free Bird again or try the other specialty sandwiches! I've already suggested my other friends who've never been here before to try it out also!
author: Athena W.

description: The food was really good. I had the corned beef sandwich, my friend had the BLT and both were very tasty. But I also have to commend them on their delivery service. I was notified that there was a problem with my order. They expressed their apologies and let me know a brand-new order was being made for me. Before I knew it my order was delivered.  I will definitely order from them again.
author: Mary A.

description:
I came to Pop's and ordered a Reuben. The girl at the counter asked me what type of bread I wanted. Hmm, good question... I guess the type of bread that usually comes on a Reuben. Rye... yes rye.

When, I received my sandwich I said oh my!! I loved the nicely toasted bread. I loved the huge amounts of meat. I wish the sauerkraut was a little bit sweeter and that they put some more sauce but overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my Reuben.

It was also nice they threw in a loli... thanks Pop!
author: Sam T.

description:
I'm really big on sandwiches. And this little hole in the wall was a great find. They even give you a Lollipop as a dessert type of thing. By far one of my favorites.

I really enjoy the Politically Correct on a sweet roll with provolone. I love all the veggies and top it all off with some jalapeños, I'm all set.

Now I'm giving Pop's a 4star rating only because they messed up my girlfriend's sandwich today. The worker forgot to add a couple of things to spice up her sub. But it was fixed and she then enjoyed the sandwich. 

I do recommend this spot if you're looking for a good sandwich spot for decent prices.

It's also right near Twin Peaks! Good sub, great view (on clear days)..you're good to go.
author: Arielle O.

description: Burn a sandwich and forget the stuffing... Single star review every time!  Best of luck, burning sandwiches and passing them off on customers, rather than redo the sandwich!!
author: M L.

description:
Hearty sandwich fare
Easily a peer to Castro Ike's
(With better views and
Friendly family service)

When they get busy,
They put callers on terminal hold


The "Free Bird"
Is Thanksgiving 
Each and every 
Day of the year

The Twin Peaks
Could feed twins
author: Lloyd M.

description: Always tasty food, super nice people and usually has my food ready by the quoted time!  Free Bird is my go-to!
author: Emily C.

description:
Good quality subs in my neighborhood is always nice.

^______________^ I like that they include a lollipop with a sub order - it makes me feel 5 years old again after I eat my sub. Hehe.

You can choose the type of bread you like, similar to most sub places but the fact that this place is a Mom and Pop's shop - adds a little home to the sub. 

Their prices are what you normally expect from a sub place nowadays - better quality than subways I would say - and it feels more personal when you order from here. lol.

Anything with cheese here is a go in my book. Teehee. 

Try their Twin Peaks sub though - as well as their other specials. (:
author: Susan Y.

description: Good lunch spot,  good value, nice peeps. That said, I wouldn't go out of my way for this place.
author: Antonia T.

description: The sandwiches there are absolutely disgusting. Do yourself a favor and drive to MC Donald's or Subway instead!
author: Ho N.

description: $13 for a turkey bacon and cranberry + plus coke was a bit expensive for me. The size of the sandwich could be bigger to be frank but I'm a big eater. The taste was good. i love that they toast every sandwich so my dutch crunch had extra crunch to it. I wish that the sandwich I got also had the special dressing too but I guess I'll just have to come back another time to get that. I think I will definitely keep coming back to try more sandwiches but I really wish it was a place that would take me from subcenter.
author: edward k.

description: I've been going methodically through the menu ordering every sandwich. They are tasty, big, and the sourdough bread is especially fine. I like Ike's and this is as good as Ike's without the ordeal.
author: Xian J.

description: The bread was toasted nicely and the price is fair. Don't really have anything to rave or complain about so because of the lack of enthusiasm I have for the sandwich, it was a slight above average experience for me. Definitely a sandwich shop of choice.
author: Elaine Y.

description: Love trying new delis! Today I tried pops, it's small, but cute and cleans and has awesome location (easy parking). The sand which itself was good, nothing great, but it got the job done. The only thing is about there sandwiches is I guess all of them come hot! And my was very toasty, I wish it was a little less.So, if u want a fresh cold sand which,make sure you say so! The meat is cut super thin and piled on! The People working there are super nice! The lollipop you get with your sandwich is a cute little trademark. Otherwise, I would say it's a so/so deli. Def has room for more potential.
author: Jay V.

description: Wow guys...an hr and a half for delivery and not even an apology? I'm sure the sandwich is good but mine is a soggy hr and a half old mess. Thanks a lot for the charming first impression. Fortunately for me, Yelp gave me the power to extend the same courtesy out to you.
author: Gregory W.

description: Hands down, Twin Peaks is my favorite! On dutch crunch + pesto sauce! It has the bacon, the avocoado, ham, turkey, and other usual veggies! A sandwich + a tootsie pop all for $7!
author: Lianne D.

description: Best sandwiches in San Francisco. That's right, I said it. Get the 'Twin Peaks' sandwich, it's to die for. Also, every time I've been in the service has been EXCELLENT. Very light-hearted, hard-working folks.
author: Jacob N.

description:
Great find! Less than 5 mins away from my place, and satisfies my sandwich craving.  The Twin Peaks and One Flap Down on a french roll are very good.  Toasted, very flavorful and rather large sammies.  Have to try other specialty sandwiches off the menu!

The girls behind the counter were friendly and fast at making sandwiches, considering they were taking phone orders too.
author: Lesliegh H.

description: I had ordered from here before and was so impressed I ordered again to be extremely let down. I ordered a meatball sandwich which came very cold and soggy the bread was falling apart. The cheese on here wasn't even melted it looked disgusting. We also had ordered a grilled cheese; the cheese wasn't even melted the cheese was cold and thick. Delivery took 1 hour and 40 minutes and it was delivered by a round table employee which shocked me. When we called to let them know they refused any sort of refund or even replacements sandwiches made correctly. I even offered to take photos so they could see the sandwich. I should have take $22.00 and thrown it in the trash it would have made a better use of my money.
author: Paul H.

description: Sandwiches were absolutely delicious. I live abou twenty minutes away and recieved my delivery order within the hour--quick enough that my sandwiches did not get cold or soggy. The free bird is the best thanksgiving style sandwich I have ever had. Good bread, delicious meats and a nice array of extras. Def ordering again
author: Scott H.

description: Driven past this little hole in the wall dozens of times and finally came in due to a friends recommendation. Got the twin peaks and damn was it good! Ham, turkey, bacon, avocado and easily the best dutch crunch I've ever had. It all starts with the bread on a sandwich for me and this was spot on. Phenomenal sandwich, I'll be coming back very soon!
author: Jonah G.

description: The main reason why I go here is the bearded hipster dude with incredible blue eyes. If he were a bartender in the Castro, he could retire in a few years.
author: Lotion M.

description: As soon as this place gets slightly crowded the quality goes down and the service goes way down. They do not staff it well enough on weekends to deal with the increase in demand.  A sandwich should not take as long as a pizza to make.
author: Vince S.

description: Very friendly and great sandwiches. Only 1 problem. Theres a homeless guy that hang out in front of the shop and he has a big azz booger in his nose
author: Craig L.

description:
I was sadly unimpressed by Pops. I have been here twice, and both times they messed up my sandwich (which was not a complicated order by any means). On one occasion when I ate there with a friend, my sandwich was wrong not one, but twice. I ended up eating the second one anyway since my friend was nearly done with hers.

I really wanted to like this place because it is conveniently located to me, has easy parking, and should be delicious. I might give it another chance, but for the hassle that I keep encountering it might be more worth hitting up Roxie, Sub Center, or Marina Sub.
author: Nora S.

description:
Ordered online yesterday and was promised an estimated delivery time. After 45 mins passed of the estimated time I called them and they said it was in the car with the driver and it should be there any minute. 2 more hours passed and no sandwiches. 
I tried calling them again but kept getting sent to voicemail right away. Finally a little over 3 hours later my sandwiches came... I hope you're not starving when you order from these people.
author: Tamar G.

description:
So all I wanted today was a sandwich during the Niner game. Didn't want to go out and decided to order from Pops. The internet ordering system was great, fast, and easy. But...

It took 2 1/2 hours to get our food. After repeated phone calls the delivery guy finally showed up. Pops shares their delivery service with Round Table Pizza. There was no way for them to get in contact with the delivery guy. All they know is when the last order had been dropped off. 

My recommendation, go in to the shop. The food was great. But don't order online. You may have starved to death before it shows up!
author: Dave W.

description: Very, very disappointed.  I waited over 1 hour and 55 minutes to be called back from the restaurant who tells me the driver was at my house and no one answered.  Sorry that's bullsh*t.  I've been waiting and no one rang my doorbell or called me on my cell phone.  Sorry folks you just lost my business!
author: Patrick N.

description: After reading so many great reviews I decided to try this place.  I'm not sure if I ordered the wrong sandwiches or if it was because my expectations were too high, but I wasn't the least bit impressed.  I felt like I've had much better sandwiches at other sandwich shops - even at Safeway.  The staff seemed to be friendly, but the food wasn't impressive.
author: Ron W.

description: Excellent! Support these guys. The shop is clean, the staff are kind, the menu is big and the quality is fantastic. Better than all the chains, and better than most individual sandwich shops too.
author: Eric O.

description: Food was fresh and tasty, Saturday service was a bit slow, but they guy behind the counter was really nice. I'd return. My rating is 3 stars!
author: urban r.

description:
Sandwiches are good/fine.

Service is awful.  Extremely slow, lots of attitude.

I gave it three tries, and every time was the same story.  I'm going to West Portal subs from now on.
author: Patrick L.

description:
This was one of my favorite places to grab some food for lunch when I lived in Miraloma Park.  They have a wide selection of sandwiches; my personal favorite was the Big Fat Greek Sandwich.  Yum!

They close rather early, so not a good dinner option.  And while the service is always friendly, it can be on the slow side, so I recommend calling ahead with your order.
author: Matt Y.

description:
I just spotted this brand new (less than a week old), old school, toasted sub shop near Tower Market in the Twin Peaks area.  Style wise, it's like Submarine Center and Gene's Liquor - toasted subs with Italian dressing (secret sauce).  The sandwiches are bigger with more filling than Submarine Center and they taste better too.  

You choose your meat and bread for the regular sandwiches ($5.47 - $6.47) or you can choose one of their specialty sandwiches.  There's one vegetarian sandwich (Politically Correct).  I tried the One Flap Down ($6.47, don't really understand the name) with turkey, salami, ham (which I omitted), American cheese, lettuce, thin tomato slices, red onions, mayo, mustard, pepperoncini and special dressing on Dutch Crunch.  Positives: Generous amount of meat, great bread, hefty sandwich.  Minor flaws: not enough veggies, especially the red onions and tomatoes, too much mustard, and it wasn't toasted long enough.  It was still cold in the center.  I'm sure they'll adjust this and increase the toasting time.  Or ask for it extra toasty.  Jalapenos are free.  You can add on soup, salad, chips, cookies and soft serve ice cream.  

The shop is bright and clean with a couple of tables.  The owner was really nice and would like to adjust his menu to reflect the preferences of the community.  I hope they have good meatballs.  3.5 stars for now but I bet that they will improve since they just opened.  I think adding more vegetarian options would be a smart move (e.g., egg salad, cheese) Credit cards accepted.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Ok, here's the truth: The sandwiches are pretty darn good. However, the delivery service is horrible. To get three sandwiches delivered four blocks, it took nearly two hours. After an hour I was ready to walk up the hill and get them myself.

I'll go back for the food, but I'll never order delivery from them again. You can call ahead for your order so its ready when you so up, so just do that. Otherwise, its a good solid sandwich place with big subs.
author: Emily M.

description:
I walked past Pop's for months, waiting for it to open, determined to be the first to review it, but somehow I missed opening day and Lolia beat me to the punch.  Oh well, can't win em all.  Actually, it's sort of tough to make it here as they're only open 10-6 on weekdays, exactly the hours I'm not around.  So I had to wait for a chance to come by on the weekend.

It's basically your typical shoebox with a few tables, although the living-room(?) balcony in the back is a twist.  Too bad you can't sit up there.  They don't seem to have a signature sandwich, so I went with the Twin Peaks, which more or less has the works.  Not bad, but it's not going to unseat Roxie's.  And as for quick bites on this block, Miraloma Market's burritos are still #1.  But Pop's is a welcome addition--we've actually got a decent spectrum of food choices here now.
author: Wes M.

description:
Great Sandwich......The "Free Bird" is a Thanksgiving Dinner in a  Bun........ Awesome!!  
Every time I go to Pops I say to my self, I'll try a different sandwich but I can't help it and I order a "Free Bird". Best sandwich around. Oh and no better way to finish lunch than with a Tootsie Roll Pop.
author: Frank H.

description: Great little sandwich shop.  I had only tried the Free Bird without stuffing a few times, and thought it was delicious.  By accident, I ordered one with stuffing as it's suggested on the menu.  It may be the best mistake I've ever made.  I cannot order anything else.  It truly is Thanksgiving in a bun.
author: Tiffany S.

description: Fantastic sandwiches, very reasonable for the size and a great variety of choices. Trying to be healthy there's wheat bread choices, but their dutch crunch is fabulous. They offer their "special sauce" and are kind enough if you get one on way home or to work they'll put it in a lil cup so your sammie doesn't get soggy. There's a card too you get a free sandwich after a few purchases, and a free tootsie roll pop is served along with your sandwich too.
author: Jean C.

description:
Holy ass my fellow reviewers of Pops.....what's with all the ..."well...you could just go down to Mollie stones and get a ...blah blah blah blah....". Shaddap! Mollie stones "deli" sandwiches suck a pile of taints compared to this place, or most small local delis...so yeah...stop with the weak comparison, it makes you sound lame.    
Pops, makes a good sandwich with quality stuff.  I've always seen friendly staff.  Service is a little bit slow.  Prices are very good.  Sandwiches are a little small for me.  Totally different style from subcenter, but cheaper.  No better or worse, just different .  
Very similar style and taste to ikes, but without the reecockulous wait and  too cool for the room attitude. Plus easy parking here. 
Frequent buyer card pleases me. 
Its a good place.
author: H K.

description: In a city where it's all about Ike's, this sandwich shop can definitely give them a run for their money. My boyfriends favorite is their chicken salad sandwich (the chicken salad is homemade and fresh), my favorite is the Herb Tribute. I love me a good Italian sandwich!!! It's a great lunch spot, but I would recommend calling ahead to order cause they can get a little busy :)
author: Kimberly E.

description:
consistently good. my vice? 

LANCELOTTI ON DUTCH CRUNCH.

RIP to "Pop" who passed February 14th 2011.
author: Susy C.

description: High Quality subs --- I love Joey bag o donuts sub, wish i had metabolism to eat few times a week haha -- found out they deliver, def gotta try that soon
author: John O.

description: Awesome staff!  Maria, David, and Toni are amazing.  They always make sure there is no cheese on my sandwiches and gets my food ready ASAP.  As usual, everything is toasted to perfection.  Try their spam masubi in Mondays and Thursdays.
author: Stan V.

description: They jettisoned the softserve machine. I can hardly blame them for all of the angst it caused them in repairs, but ... damn. Will I be as motivated to stop by every week without the allure of a swirlcone as appetizer?
author: Laurie N.

description: One of The best sandwiches I've ever had! They put so much effort into each sandwich and they come out so perfect. I would recommend this shop to anyone because of all of the their different choices.
author: Brenden Q.

description:
Closest thing to a real Philly Italian hoagie that I've had so far in SF. They use the right bread, they use high quality meats (unlike many other local places) and you can get the right flavor combo. To do this, get the Lancelloti without the artichoke hearts, leave off the mayo and mustard, get oil and vinegar and it's like you're in South Philly.

I like other sandwiches just as much (eg Monterey Deli) but this place gets the Italian hoagie vibe down.
author: Sam P.

description:
What's up with this place? Its kinda hard to figure it out. You wanna like it. You give it a couple of chances but there's something not there. The closes thing I can think of to describe it, is a lack of energy. 

The sandwiches are okay. You could get the same down the street at Tower Market aka Mollie Stones for less (which doesn't happen with most things). The sandwiches are kinda expensive but I guess that's why you get a tootsie roll pop with your sandwich. 

Also the wait is way too long....for what the sandwich is.
author: Rick C.

description:
They make your sandwich with care. That is why there is somewhat of a wait at Pop's Sandwich Shop. Sandwiches are hefty and filled with the right amount of condiments and sauce. The chicken salad and BLT sandwiches on dutch crunch are delicious and will fill you up. When I eat their sandwiches it does not look or taste like it was thrown together in a rush with the lettuce and tomatoes falling out. It's nice to actually enjoy a well made sandwich from a local shop that is not hyped up or overrated.

The employees are friendly; they informed me after I ordered my chicken salad sandwich that it will take ten minutes to make. I did not mind since I figured they have to build (with care) and toast it. Pop's also serves soup, simple salads and frozen yogurt. I've been here twice and I plan to come back again.

*diner tip: plenty of parking! get a sandwich to go and enjoy it on a nice picnic at twin peaks or mount davidson if the weather is nice. otherwise, dining in at Pop's is also fine since the restaurant is pretty clean.
author: Jocelyn P.

description:
I happen to be sifting through the Valupak coupons (once a year occurrence) and saw a BOGO coupon for this place. I looked on Yelp and saw that it had decent reviews so I thought I'd go ahead and try it.

Ordered the Twin Peaks on wheat roll, friend had "the GEM" (not on the website, but it's eggplant marinara sandwich) and both were so delicious. BIG sandwich (no "small or large" bs), nicely toasted, warm meat, perfect amount of avocado... ahhhhhhhhh. Yum. $7 bucks total. NiCE. Cheap. 

We were the only ones there at 10am but they were catering an event (tons of sandwiches in big bags all over) so we did sort of wait a few minutes but the sandwich was totally worth it and staff was very friendly. 

I'm over sub center and their chaotic disorganized craziness and over-hyped salad dressing (although the three amigos are SO nice). Give this place a shot.  

Parking lot in front with meters.
author: Christine Y.

description: Had the tuna sandwich. Had no flavor whatsoever. Maybe next time I'll try something else
author: Al K.

description:
Wow! These sandwiches are ridiculously delicious! 

Pop's Sandwich Shop is located in that Tower shopping center you always pass by but never stop for. I encourage you to seek out this place. The parking is a breeze, the staff is incredibly friendly, and they make a hell of a sandwich! ... I'm pretty sure I'll never eat a sandwich from another establishment again!
author: Jami C.

description:
Sandwiches are pretty good but ten minutes for a turkey, salami, no mayo on Dutch crunch? A bit long for a simple sandwich.

First time I was there the woman remade my sandwich twice. Not the most efficient shop.
author: Selino V.

description:
Sorry to say we had a bad enough experience we won't be going back to Pop's.  After a long span of being a regular customer, I called in an order on the 25th and the guy who helped me didn't take my number till the end of the call - which meant he missed the automation aspect of knowing my order, and since I had to tell it to him and he was slow ("OK... so you don't want no mayo...") it started off bad.  What is usually a 2-3 minute call was 7-8.  Them the actual sandwiches is what ticked me off the most - both were soggy and sloppy.  My husband didn't even finish his - and we are regulars so that was a big negative sign!  We commented that if it was our first time at Pop's we never would have become regulars.

Major bummer!  Hopefully the manager will see this and make some changes.
author: Julia B.

description:
Not the worst, and definitely far from the best is how I would describe this place. There was nobody there when I showed up late in the afternoon, so I was expecting relatively fast service. My sandwich took almost 10 minutes to make, and when it came out the girl that made it at almost a kitty corner angle, and to make matters worse she split the thing 90/10 so I basically had a bite size piece on one end and a long pointed mess on the other. The outer crust on the bread was so hard from over toasting that when I bit into it the contents of the sandwich just squished out the sides.

Why almost every place in this city toasts sandwiches by default never ceases to confuse me. Do people here really like the taste of warm mayo and pickles? Some things are definitely better toasted, but a tuna sub? Come on!
author: Nate S.

description: I don't understand the bad reviews.  The sandwiches are great and the people who work there have always been friendly to me.  I call ahead with my order and the ten minutes it takes for me to drive over is plenty of time for them to make my sandwich.  I'm with Frank H.  I can't get enough of the Free Bird.  I too try to talk myself into ordering a different one, but can never do it.  This bird you can not change.  Lord knows I can't change.
author: Lucy P.

description:
I lived so close by this place that I decided it was worth checking out one day. It definitely had a "mom and pop" shop type of feeling and at the moment was run by two younger people, looking like they just came out of college. They were pretty laid back and friendly. I decided to get the Twin Peaks special on wheat bread. I was pretty happy with the results. Portions-wise, it was great. Meat was fresh and good use of condiments. Plus, they throw in a tootsie roll lollipop. It was a bit expensive, coming close to $9 but most of the food in the area isn't cheap. 

The wait was a bit long (~15 minutes) and considering there was only one guy in front of me, I think they could've done a quicker job. One nice thing they offer is if you buy 10 sandwiches, you get the next one free. I'm not sure I'll be back that often but it's nice to know it's there.

In general, this place is nice. Food is good. Wait is terrible. Who knows how long you have to wait for food during a lunch hour rush. If I don't feel like driving to Roxie's, it's actually worth the walk/bike ride over here. 4 stars.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Good sandwiches, particularly the "Pops Special" with chicken salad. The Tootsie Pop with each sandwich is a nice touch. If not for their notoriously slow service, this would be a five-star review.
author: Edna T.

description: Mediocre Sandwich, 2 hour delivery. Won't be ordering again.
author: jared c.

description: This sandwich shop has delicious and original sandwiches! Service can be a tad slow but they are always friendly. Our favorites are the twin peaks and the free bird!  DELICIOUS!
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
I really love Pop's sandwiches. First off, it is a small family owned sandwich shop which automatically makes it better than the Subway's and Togo's of the world in my book. The sandwiches are great, I had a love affair with the meatball (I have no clue what the reviewer down there was talking about their meatballs are FANTASTIC) and recently switched to the chicken pesto (it had another name but I don't remember) and that was also delicious. They have top of the line potato salad and chicken salad made by Maria, one of the owners. I love this place as they have so many options and I love supporting the small business owners of SF. Also, you get a lollipop with your sandwich, which I think brings out the kid in all of us. Some other great things about Pop's, they've got a pretty legit kids menu AND soft serve ice cream. 

Pop's is awesome & Mollie stone is WAY too expensive. Go to Pops.
author: Cara W.

description:
I love their sandwiches but unfortunately their delivery service SUCKS!!! This is my first yelp review ever, I'm not a review kinda person but this got me a little pissed off. It took the delivery boy over an hour to deliver a sandwich to my house which is 4 blocks away (not exaggerating). I would've walked there myself like I normally do but I got my ass kicked by the Flu this season. By the time I got my sandwich it was cold and soggy, and my soda was warm. This is not the first time I've had a bad experience with their delivery service.

Other than that, their food is great. Simples, good proportion, soft bread, etc...

I give them 4 stars for food, but 1 star for delivery, which is why they got a 3 from me.
author: Justin M.

description: I have been waiting over an hour and a half for my food.  Twice I've been told it was on it's way.  They told me less than an hour for delivery.  It's 3pm on a Friday afternoon.  Not evening. Not lunch rush.  Never ordering from here again
author: Kim M.

description: I followed fellow Yelpers on their review of "free bird". One of the review was right, its a Thanksgiving feast on a sandwich. I got it on a dutch crunch. One advice,  pay extra for the stuffing. And I got a tootsie roll pop inside the bag. Pretty nice touch eh!
author: roderick s.

description:
I ordered a plain ol' regular Turkey sandwhich on a roll ($5.97) with "everything". It was every bit as good as the Sub Center down the street at West Portal, but without the attitude, parking hassles, and mysterious change in prices of their sandwiches & extras.
My turkey S/W came toasted, and dripping with the sauce they add along with the usual mayo, mustard, etc. 
This was damn good. 
Very decent size too. They also toss in a Tootsie Pop with each sandwich!
And to top it off, they have this "Buy 3 sandwhiches, get 3 dollars off coupon" until Oct. 31. That's $5 per sandwhich. Its a great local business, easy parking. Let's support this establishment & spread the word!.
author: Adrian Z.

description: Best sub shop in San francisco so far!!! Being from minnesota...there are amazing sandwich shops that can't compare to any of these delis. I even find myself wandering to subway just to try and get a taste of home, and they suck out here. Ingredients aren't fresh...stale bread, whats the point. Pops is always delicious. Except for the one time I ordered the free bird..and it came with an avocado instead of stuffing ughhhh disgusting...but think there was just a misunderstanding when ordering, and am biased towards avocados...
author: KatieRae A.

description:
An outstanding sandwich complemented by an outstanding experience. Or is it the other way around? It doesn't matter. Things I loved:

- Friendly, thoughtful, attentive service. I appreciated how they made my sandwich just ahead of a large order so I didn't have to wait forever. And I loved that they asked if I wanted my frozen yogurt at the end so it didn't melt, and then prepared it about a minute before I polished off the last bites of my sandwich. Nice timing, and way to pay attention

- Menu bonuses, including whole wheat rolls and free cranberry sauce. Those two things along with a massive amount of turkey and veggies came together for an amazing sandwich.

- A distinctive touch, which was a tootsie pop with every order. And they had no problem swapping my chocolate for a cherry.

- Even a good client base, as the what seemed to be rowdy high school group addressed me as "sir" when asking if they could have my big table so they could all sit together. Sir? Yeah, you go ahead.

This was an easy five stars to give.
author: Jason B.

description: I came here one day after taking a 4 hour test and man was I starving. I decided to try a sandwich here. I got a roast beef sandwich on dutch crunch. It was really good, I thought it was somewhat comparable to roxies with the bread. The sandwich also came with 1/4 slice of a pickle. I never knew pickles were so good until coming here. Guess you'll never know what the outcome will be until you try. They also give Tootsie Roll Pops which I thought was pretty creative because the name of the shop is Pops.
author: Nelson G.

description: My 5-year-0ld son and I frequently have a "dudes' lunch date" here. Great sandwiches and you gotta love the Tootsie Pop they throw in.  The service is kinda slow, but once you get past that it's all good.
author: David G.

description:
I wrote a review for this place.  It was witty, clever, and insightful.

I lost the review when my browser crashed.  I can't recover it.  It's gone.

Short version:  You can get a better, cheaper sandwich down the block at Mollie Stones, or you can stay at home and make an equally good sandwich for free.  In either case, non-Pop's sandwiches generally DON'T take 15 minutes to make...
author: Kevin H.

description:
This place is AWESOME. It's near our Twin Peaks place. Drove by it so many times, but never stopped in. Finally came here on Saturday. Good choice. 

I went with the meatball hoagie. The meatballs were so moist and flavorful. The tomato sauce was also very flavorful. All topped with really good provolone cheese, toasted on sourdough. REALLY REALLY good sandwich. I've found my favorite meatball hoagie in SF. Hands down.
author: Jen D.

description:
Pop's Sandwich employees have poor customer service and they do not care about their customers. They serve BURNT SANDWICHES for $7.00 and the owner Jeffrey will tell you not to come back if you complain. See the burnt sandwich for yourself. 

http://img3.imageshack.us/img3/8777/burntsandwich.jpg
