Cons: Moody employees, burnt sandwiches, unsanitary conditions, high calorie sandwiches, and terrible customer service. You can tell the sandwiches aren't great because this shop is always EMPTY.

Pros: Close to Mollie Stones down the street where you can get better sandwiches. Motivates you to walk down to Mollie Stones to get superb customer service.

Check out their burnt sandwich (link above). Doesn't this sandwich look burnt? You would want to think their employees care about their customers and that they will remake the sandwich before serving it to you but nope. Enjoy our Pop's Special Burnt Sandwich. 

For more details read about my rude experience below.

I go to Pop's sandwich all the time to buy my sandwiches and sometimes my sandwiches are burnt. Today on Oct 28, 2010 at 11:47 am (Thursday) I bought it to the Owner's attention and spoke to Jeffrey personally and showed him the pictures. I stated to him that this happened to me 5-6 times and he asked me how come I didn't complain the first time. I replied that, "I can tolerate it a few times cause people make mistakes. Then after a few times, I'll complain." Owner Jeffrey gave me a free sandwich and stated that it was on the house. In addition, Jeffrey stated, "Here's a word of advice, I heard Molly Stones make good sandwiches" after giving me the free sandwich. (He implicitly stated to me to never to come back to his store and I'll definitely take his advice to never buy sandwiches at this place again.) 

Furthermore, Pop's sandwiches are made by employees that do not use gloves. They can be cleaning the tables with their dirty towels and then be making your sandwiches with their dirty hands afterwards. My free sandwich today has human hair in it and I totally lost my appetite for their sandwich after the poor customer service by their owner Jeffrey. The employees are rude and moody like their owner Jeffrey. If you call ahead, you MUST leave a phone number or the employees will give you a difficult time. There are no exceptions even though you are across the street.
author: unknown u.

description:
Solid 4 stars.  I've been there twice, and came away both times very happy with the food.  The service is good, and the menu has some great variety.  

There are 3 places for sandwiches within a block of Pop's, and I must say that Pop's is the best.
author: Nelson W.

description:
The first time I went to Pop's I saw the owner teaching a new employee how to make a sandwich. He explained to him very patiently, "It doesn't matter if it takes you a long time to make a sandwich, as long as you get it right." That emphasis on quality really shows at Pop's. 

I've always gotten the "politically correct" although I feel like a jerk ordering it. Isn't politically correct a little pejorative? The forced humility is worth it though because it is an awesome sandwich, with just the right balance of veggies, condiments, cheese and bread. You know when you order a sandwich and it tastes too mustard-y or bread-y or cheesy? That's never happened to me here. They toast their bread well, so if you don't like that, maybe you could tell them or something. Personally I'm a fan.
author: Michael M.

description:
I am very excited to have a new "local" sandwich shop open in town. My first experience was extremely positive as I enjoyed the "Herb's Tribute" meatball sandwich. Being a San Francisco native, I grew up on Herb's meatball sandwiches on Taravel. The Pop's meatball sandwich is fantastic with high quality meatballs, delicious baked bread and extremely filling for my hearty appetite. 

There are many other signature sandwiches that caught my attention, so I look forward to trying and reviewing the other offerings. One big hit for sure will be the soft serve ice cream. In the pouring rain, I saw 7 people order soft serve in a 30 minute period.

Finally, I was fortunate to meet one of the owner's when I ordered my sandwich and he gave me the story behind Pop's. The shop is owned by two brothers with strong SF roots (attended Saint Ignatius and USF). It's named after their 94 year old grandfather "Pop" who is one of their great inspirations and a sandwich aficionado. 

PS - "One Flap Down" refers to how Jeffery Leonard from 1980's San Francisco Giants rounded the bases after hitting a home run.
author: Michael P.

description:
Awesome sandwiches!! My favorite is the Herb with jalepenos on sourdough - sooOoOo yummy!! And my new favorite is the Free Bird..I love Thanksgiving dinner and that's what it makes me think of :)

The price is good compared to other delis...and they really take the time to carefully make it and toast it just right...

The staff is also very friendly...I just highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice, hearty sandwich!

OOooOOoh man I'm totally craving one right now!!!
author: Renee F.

description:
I've taken a short-term job in the mountain range that protects the vibrancy of the Castro from whatever-ness of the Sunset, otherwise known as Twin Peaks. And while Twin Peaks is known for its fabulous views, it should really be known for being the home to Pop's Sandwich Shop.

Pop's is hands down one of the top three sandwich shops in the city. Not only do they have your standard sandwiches, they also have specialties, like turkey and cranberry, or an avocado club. Also the quality is way better than "that sub place" on West Portal, and the environment and staff are much more pleasant than "that creepy dark place" two blocks down.

Plus, they price everything so that after tax it always comes out to a "round" number, like $7 even, or $6.50.

Plus Plus, they give you a free tootsie roll pop.

Pop's is so great that rather than eating my sandwich on my lunch break, then coming back and wasting time at work by yelping, I stopped half way through my "Free Bird Sandwich" to write this review.
author: Matt C.

description:
I just had the "Joey Bagadonuts," which is meatballs, chicken breast, bacon, provolone, and marinara.  

Fantastic.  Why there isn't a line out the door is a mystery to me.
author: Lester W.

description:
I'll tell ya, I've been to almost every sandwich shop in the city in search of the best sandwich and although I can't claim this as "it", it's pretty close (Roxie Food Center and Gene's Liquors trump it, so I can't give Pop's a 5 star rating). I'd have to agree with Jim D that the hours of operation could be better (Round table is open till 2, get some of those guys to go next door and make me a sandwich instead!).

The price is about average, less then Sub Center for about the same amount. The sandwich itself is damn good. Very good proportions of meat and other toppings, very good signature sandwiches or you can custom build your own. I've had a few of their signatures and they've come up with some really good combinations.

As always a huge factor in any business: location, location, location. I live in the area and was very happy to see that they turned an old shoe store into a Sub shop, which was much needed for the area. It's a new store so they may have some kinks to work out (shares Credit Card phone line with Round Table next door [the brothers' Spiegel own that too], employee training could be improved ala Anton S's review below) but for the most part they nailed the staples of a good sandwich shop: price, location, good proportions and the ever so important toaster oven!
author: Jim O.

description: Love the twin peaks. Make sure you request your pickle if you order to go.
author: M R.

description:
nice people nice location.

prices are okay too.  

its got decent sandwiches but you can get sandwiches at mollie stones down the street.  i'm not saying don't go here but realistically if they were a good sandwich shop they'd be filled when School of the Arts gets out for lunch.  you can get in and out of here with only a few people in front of you for the sandwich.

DO NOT get the meatball.  Sorry but its not very good.  anything else is fine.  just not the meatball.

i don't compare sandwich places.  i just eat at the one i'm nearest at when i want to buy one.
author: Bing D.

description: Yummy !!! I just went to Pop's for the first time last night , we called in our order and 10 minutes later it was ready , it was fresh and delicious & 2 minutes from my house :) If you're in the neighborhood and want a really great sandwich , try Pop's , I had no idea it would be so good and filling !
author: Laurie K.

description:
This is just what the area needed! Every sandwich tastes real good and it is made with love! Nothing held back like some places that penny pinch how much they give you! Service is always friendly, always with a smile!! Couldn't wait for it to open and now I'm sooo happy there is more variety in the area!! 

I can't remember the names of the sandwiches (some are pretty creative) but there is one called SF or Bridge something that is good and the Pastrami is great, too!!!
author: M R.

description: I want to support this place because its close to my home, and its a small, family-owned business, but unfortunately I can't rave about Pop's due to the little bitchy counter girl and her mean-mugging stares (I won't put you on total blast hunny but it wasn't the sweet red-head.) The sandwiches are good, typical deli sandwich shop - good menu, somewhat decent prices (maybe a little on the steeper side but its SF - everything is overpriced.) I would rather just drive my ass down to the Sub Center in West Portal (BEST SANDOS in the city.) then walk to Pop's and deal with that little brat behind the counter.
author: S. M.

description:
Pop's makes amazing subs.  I've tried many subs from Pop's and my favorite is the Lancelotti.  Service is fine, but sometimes they get busy, so it takes a little longer to get your order. (I always call ahead and pick up the order, since I'm lucky to live close by.) But the quality of the sandwiches is what really shines. I also love the Tootsie Pops in each order - nice touch!

Highly recommended if you're anywhere in the neighborhood!
author: Dan S.

description:
Pretty good subs for a good price. Lot's of options beyond the traditional subs.

One thing that bothered us is that servers don't use gloves when making your sandwich. And some of them do handle money too.
author: Y G.

description:
Yum! Yum! Yum!

My friend picked up a bunch of sandwiches from Pop's and literally all of them were amazing. They don't skimp on anything, and their hearty sandwiches quickly became my new fav sub shop. 

I can't wait to check out their meatball sub next time.
author: lindsey l.

description:
I saw ads for Pop's at a USF basketball game, so my friend and I decided to check it out.  Their sandwiches are toasted and are pretty big with a generous amount of meat.  The special sauce is the same old Italian dressing like concoction, but it's still good.  The owner is a cool dude.  Pop's may have trouble getting business from Sub Center, but their prices are cheaper and the store is far less crowded.

Twin Peaks and a bottle of Coke - 7.47+tax
author: Matt A.

description:
We've gone about 6 times now and up until recently were ok with  the service.  This last time, we walk in and stand by the counter to look at the menu on the wall noticing  the guy cleaning the prep area  w/ gloves on.  He takes our order and puts out his gloved hand for the money and then makes our sandwich with the same gloved hands.

Needless to say, that's the last time we go.  Also, don't like the idea of candy with your sandwich; there's far too much sugar in the American diet as it is.  Rather have a cheaper sandwich and no candy or an option for something healthier (baby carrots, edamame?)
author: Foodsy C.

description: Pop's is AMAZING. Not only are their sandwiches fantastic, but they deliver almost anywhere in San Francisco, including the Sunset. I cannot give them enough brownie points for that! They also almost always have a buy-one-get-one-free deal circulating, which makes it very affordable as well. You can pretty much get 2 sandwiches for $10 or less. I have tried the Twin Peaks sandwich, and it one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. I also tried their "free bird", which was okay... but I imagine it would have what it takes if I didn't forget to order it with stuffing on it. I must not fail to mention that their potato salad is to die for. I personally hate potato salad, but their recipe is so delicious I am almost tempted to ask them how they make it so damn good.
author: Katie S.

description:
I love this place. Signed up today just so I could write a review on it.

I live about 5 minutes away and when I'm too lazy, I just order for delivery. Like many people have stated, I would as well recommend the Lancelotti sandwich, it is sooo damn good. Each time I ordered, the lady was very nice on the phone and if you previously ordered from them, they have your last order on record and ask if you would like the same thing. Pop's has really good sandwiches and THEY DELIVER! so you really can't complain. =)
author: Erinn P.

description: I've been back to this place several times since my original review and I had to post an update. Pop's has really improved in the couple years they have been open. Their sandwiches are something special now...ingredients are great and their awesome bread tastes freshly baked every time(must have the sweet roll). All together its a delicious toasted sub they put together...you'll want to call ahead if you can as the wait can often be 10-12 mins...
author: Bryan C.

description: The sandwiches are decent. I work for a local company in San Francisco and we had a large birthday order for sandwiches. When the order was called in, we gave a specific employee name for each sandwich ordered. After being told the sandwiches would be ready between 11:30 and 12, our sandwiches were not ready until 12:30.  Back at the office when the sandwiches arrived, they were all packaged with the incorrect name. Most sandwiches had the incorrect ingredients and bread. One sandwich was left off the order. Not only will we not order from Pop's again, we will not recommend it to family and friends.
author: Steve B.

description: I eat a Pops periodically and I enjoy their sandwiches.  They make a great salami sandwich.  It is a nice neighborhood place and I can't think of a better sandwich shop in this part of town.
author: Michael P.

description:
I had the Twin Peaks sandwich on rye and I was pleasantly surprised. The sauces were really tasty and prevented the sandwich from being too dry, but it wasn't soggy either. The sandwich was good size for lunch. I also got the small macaroni side salad and it was tasty as well.

It was pretty busy when I got there around 1245pm. Next time I'll try to avoid the regular lunch hour, especially now that school has started. However, even though they were busy I got my sandwich pretty quickly in 10-15 minutes.

I'm definitely going again.
author: Adore P.

description:
Pop's is good for classic american sub. 
I'm not a fan of quizno's or subway- and I'm not that into the deli sandwiches you get at a safeways or whatnot...so Pop's really has impressed me. 
I was happy to finally find a replacement for the cafe near my high school off Ellis cuz only that place had the chicken breast with avocado, swiss, and cranberry over dutch crunch ---- until I found Pop's. oh, btw, the sandwich I described is custom-made and that's what you should get when you go there. to be honest, I haven't tried anything else cuz I just love my own. lol. but I'm sure everything else is good too. 
they sneak a tootsie lollipop into your bag, which is different for being a food joint, but I think it's cute cuz it's a nice little surprise at the end --- whoops, if you've read this, sorry I ruined it for you!
author: Nancy Y.

description: Against my better judgment, I decided to order and consume in one sitting a Joey Bagadonuts (meatballs, chicken breast, bacon, provolone, and marinara sauce) sandwich.  It was very good, although it was truly big enough for two meals.  Eating the whole thing left me with no room for the complimentary Blow-Pop, either.
author: Rick E.

description: This is a great place to run in and grab a sandwich.  The ingredients are delicious and always fresh.  The staff is super nice too.  Just make sure you either call in for take out or just show up and order.  The delivery process is a painful one that you should avoid.  Overall, a great place to get sandwich and Tootsie-pop.
author: Daniel S.

description: It's not quite as good as Ike's, but Pop's is close. The staff is friendly. The food is great. The restaurant is usually clean. There's not much more to say here.
author: Greg B.

description:
As other reviewers have noted, Pop's is very low-key. This could either be a good thing, a not-so-good thing, or just a thing. It takes a while for a sandwich to get made, even if there's no one else waiting; the place is quiet, except for ambient conversation among staff and/or customers; the staff is polite but not enthusiastic; occasionally they'll forget something; on one visit, they'd shut down the soda machine so it wasn't available. None of this bothers me, but it bothers some folks. 

The sandwiches are tasty & toasted (and good-sized). The sides are appear to be home-made. If you want a scrumptious sandwich from a local, non-chain spot, this fits the bill. If you want high energy, a bigger but more mediocre selection, and/or the comforting but anonymous routine of a nationwide chain, then try Subway. I'm glad Pop's is in my neighborhood.
author: Michael F.

description: I have been 2 pops almost every weekend for the past couple months and there is ALWAYS parking no matter what time of day. The Sandwiches are decently priced and taste AMAZING...I usually go with turkey on sourdough with everything +jalepenos which are free 2 add on. The free bird is also amazing, it tastes like thanksgiving dinner each bite. If u eat the sandwiches at the shop you get a pickle on the side which is a nice addition to the sandwich. You also get a lollipop which is surprisingly nice after eating a sandwich. Good people working there always nice and such....GO 2 POPS its AMAZING
author: Mike F.

description: So the one thing missing in the Portola Strip Mall was a sandwich shop.  You got a gourmet market, great dry cleaners, Creighton's (Mmmmm...Creighton's), a Starbucks, requisite liquor store, a horribly small Walgreen's, Round Table Pizza, Tower Burger and a mini mart that has some freakin yummy burritos and granted, the Tower Market makes some really good deli style sandwiches that are a pretty good deal, they don't make a toasted sub a la Submarine Center.  Hence, using Sub Center as the bar and the Atomic to compare to the One Flap Down, Pop's gets a solid 4 stars.  My partner who always orders the meatball from Sub Center says The Herb Tribute has them beat.  So since we live so close I guess when the hunger for a sub strikes we'll be seeing Pop's!  Now this is dangerous....they deliver as well!
author: Don O.

description: Very good sandwiches! We ordered Warren's BLT and the Lancelotti and they were both very good, especially the Lancelotti. The sandwiches are generous, fresh, toasted, and delicious. The delivery service was quick and painless. We will definitely order from here again.
author: Reza E.

description: The only reason Pop's doesn't get 5 stars is because they take FOREVER and they close way too early.  however, i seriously think it's worth waiting for.  they deliver too!  get the roast beef on a sourdough roll... soooo good.  Pop's may have beaten subs in west portal in my book.
author: Kaitlin V.

description: Just moved in the neighborhood and SO happy to find this place!  Sandwiches are great, bread is nice and fresh and they have kid's meals plus soft serve ice cream.  Had delivered one day while unpacking - quick delivery and sandwiches traveled well.
author: Kelly B.

description: The Lancelotti is probably the best ham sandwich I've ever had; I get it on sourdough.  Call in your order - it takes them a while to make it.  Eat your sandwich while it's still hot & crunchy.  Now use the tootsie roll pop to play chase with your cat.  That's the Pop's experience.
author: Jeff W.

description: The best sandwich's in the city!  I recommend The Lancelotti!  It is amazing!   The soft serve Ice Cream is yummy & refreshing!  Makes me want to get one right now!  The service is great & very friendly!  The best part is that they deliver!!!  You can get a yummy warm deli sandwich & soft serve Ice cream for delivery!  Cheers!
author: Lynnet S.

description: I love, love, love Pop's! Yummy, delicious flavors, fresh ingredients and the folks who make the food are always darling.  I love the Wharf (like a tuna melt plus plus)  I recently tried the new chicken pesto at Maria's suggestion...I can't wait for Monday so I can go back for another one!
author: gayle p.

description: Great sandwhiches, great staff, i wouldn't eat a sandwhich from any other eatery....it's that damn good
author: Thomas E.

description: Have you ever rolled over in the mid-morning and thought hmmm, I would like a delicious sandwich, but I don't really want to move?  Eventually you work up the motivation to walk to the West Portal Sub Center or the Marina Sub Center depending where you live and you get to order the crisp delicious sub you had been salvating over in your dreams.  Well now you can have it all.  Pop's is incredible and delivers.  I stumbled upon it as I was shopping at Tower market.  They toast all of the bread and have a quality of meats that far surpasses the aformentioned sub shops.  Yes they do have secret sauce.  The Lancelotti Special is my all-time favorite.  As a native San Franciscan, I take my sub shops seriously.  We know the fabled debate was Marina Sub vs. Westportal Substation.  There is a clear winner now..It's Pops!
author: Kathryn P.

description:
I am a motherf*cking sandwich connoisseur.
Based on one experience.
This is now the closest sandwich shop to my gf's house. I was waiting for it to open for months, but I wasn't anticipating too much. And they fell well short of my already low expectations.
It must've been the cashier's first day, and they had her on the register by herself. This caused all kinds of problems for nearly everyone that ordered before and after me. She didn't know the menu or the computer, didn't know which questions to ask or when, and, in my case, completely f*cked up my order multiple times.
I ordered my sandwich, and she had to ask me a second or third time to attenpt to get my info into the computer. I ordered it with some veggies and sauces, and without some other veggies and sauces, and asked for a powerade. I handed her $10 as she quoted me $16 something as my total. I waited while the manager helped her figure out why my tab was wrong. As I sat and waited, I heard them going over the order, including him asking if it was for here or to go. She said to go, even though she hadn't asked me (it was for here).
A few minutes later, as a customer was ordering seven subs to go, I received a sandwich wrapped to go and some weird energy drink. I exchanged the energy drink for the beverage I'd ordered, not mentioning that the energy drink cost more. It wouldn't have been worth the hassle for them to figure out how to give me a refund on the difference. I opened my sub wrapper to find a sub with many of the sauces and veggies I had explicitly asked to be omitted. Multiple times. I took the sub back to the cashier, and she went to fix it. Now my sub was in line behind the guy with the huge to go order.
It came back out, this time packaged for here, and was closer to what I had ordered (I asked for extra lettuce, it had very light lettuce, but again, not worth the effort). I had asked for no pickles on the sub; they left a pickle spear under the sub in the basket, so the whole side of the sub tasted like pickle. The sub was very lightly toasted this time, rushed to be fixed for me. The turkey was flavorful but not plentiful, and the bacon was flavorless and cut so thin it was see-thru. I was hoping the sub might save the experience, but it worsened it.
Bottom line, if the cashier's not ready to be on her own, put a trainer next to her, attached at the hip. And if there's a breakdown in communication, don't hesitate to talk to the customer and apologize, instead of trying to fix it behind the scenes with the same staff that f*cked it up the first time. And if you can't get the service right, you'd better pray the food's good enough to forgive the rest of the poor experience (it wasn't).
Check out my sandwich list to find out where to go instead.
author: Matt G.

description: When pops first opened I was slightly skepitcal but since it was close I gave it try.  It is a wonderfull spot for sandwiches of all kinds.  I usually get a pastrami sandwich w/ pesto sauce.  It's always nicley toasted, warm, and delicous.  Plus their sandwichs are big (I usually eat half)The toostie pops are a nice touch too.
author: Sesily M.

description: ok after readin the other reviews I needed to voice my opinion.  Pricewise, yeah it's not $5 footlong, but that's like comparing apples to oranges.  I ordered one of their specialty sandwiches which was tuna, cheese and avacado on sliced wheat.  Yeah you think sliced wheat at a sub place, what the heck?  While I was waiting for my sandwich I was thinking just that, I should have got the dutch crunch, oh well next time.  Well when my sandwich arrived, which took about 5-7 minutes, I was quite surprised how good it was.  It came perfectly toasted, great tuna mix, with a pickle on the side.  I will definitely return...
author: Eric D.
